name: Vegan Pumpkin Pie Truffles
description: Vegan Pumpkin Pie Truffles or No Bake Pumpkin Donut Holes. 7 Ingredient No oil, No Refined Sugar. These fudgy bites are perfect for fall. Vegan Glutenfree Soyfree Recipe

video.name: PUMPKIN PIE TRUFFLES! 7 Ingr, No Oil | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
7 Ingredient Vegan Pumpkin Pie Truffles. No Refined Sugar.
ðŸ’™ FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2018/10/vegan-pumpkin-pie-truffles.html
ðŸ’™ MY BOOKS: https://veganricha.com/mybooks

Fudgy Bites, that taste like Pumpkin Pie in a fudge form! hell yes!
Pumpkin Pie Truffles or No Bake Pumpkin Donut Holes!!. 

7 Ingredients, No Bake, No oil, No Refined Sugar! And ready in 15 mins. It cannot get easier and tastier than this! Pumpkin puree gets heated with maple syrup to thicken slightly, then mixed with almond and coconut flours, as much pumpkin pie spice as you like, then rolled in a mix of cinnamon and coconut sugar. Bliss. Make a double batch! You can also make your own pumpkin pie spice, or use store bought or use just cinnamon, or other spice blends like chai spice. These fudgy balls are freezer friendly. 
Vegan Glutenfree Soyfree Recipe.

recipeIngredient: 1 cup pumpkin puree ((pure pumpkin not pie mix))
1 tsp pumpkin pie spice ((or use a mix of cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg))

recipeInstructions.text: Add pumpkin puree and maple syrup to a pan. Mix in the salt and pumpkin pie spice. Cook over medium heat for 6 to 8 mins to thicken slightly. Add in the vanilla extract if using. (You can also add in 1-2 tbsp rum or liquor of choice with maple syrup.)
recipeInstructions.name: Add pumpkin puree and maple syrup to a pan. Mix in the salt and pumpkin pie spice. Cook over medium heat for 6 to 8 mins to thicken slightly. Add in the vanilla extract if using. (You can also add in 1-2 tbsp rum or liquor of choice with maple syrup.)

recipeInstructions.text: Cool slightly then add in the almond and coconut flour. Mix well. Then let chill to absorb for 10 minutes, then mix again. If the dough is sticky, add 2 tablespoons or more almond flour. Press the mixture between your fingers to check.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool slightly then add in the almond and coconut flour. Mix well. Then let chill to absorb for 10 minutes, then mix again. If the dough is sticky, add 2 tablespoons or more almond flour. Press the mixture between your fingers to check.

recipeInstructions.text: Using your hands, form the dough into smooth balls.
recipeInstructions.name: Using your hands, form the dough into smooth balls.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix the coconut sugar and cinnamon. Roll the balls in cinnamon and sugar mixture . Store refrigerated for up to 3 days and frozen for up to a month.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix the coconut sugar and cinnamon. Roll the balls in cinnamon and sugar mixture . Store refrigerated for up to 3 days and frozen for up to a month.

keywords: no bake pumpkin donuts, pumpkin cake balls, pumpkin donut holes, pumpkin spice truffles
